author: cargofe2
title: Study and Pilot in Colombia
description: Colombia in cryptocurrencies, is developing a pilot of the financial authority that will influence the future of Cardano in this country

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal to conduct a thorough analysis of the results of the 1-year regulatory sandbox enacted by the financial supervision authority of Colombia regarding cryptocurrency implementation is interesting, and highly feasible. However, seeing as the goals of the challenge point towards the creation of an environment of laws that are more favorable or less harmful to the crypto space, with a focus on PoS and on Cardano's particularities, I believe a future iteration of this proposal should focus on the lobbying and networking aspect of the challenge, rather than just stopping at the analysis of the regulatory experiments, from which months after the tests have been launched, it can be understood that the most significant result is that financial institutions and cryptocurrency platforms can sustain alliances and operate without conflict, unlike what has happened in Colombia in the past. It should also be pointed out that, according to available information in Spanish, the SFC has only approved 4 cryptocurrencies to be paired with the colombian peso during this pilot project/regulatory sandbox: bitcoin, ethereum, litecoin and bitcoin cash, meaning that neither Cardano nor a PoS cryptocurrency will partake in the pilot, with the concurrent absence of evidence derived from the pilot for regulatory consequences that the PoS specifications would necessarily entail as opposed to PoW.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is clearly very competent and has the necessary experience in the public sector in Colombia, with a consultancy firm already in place to develop the described analysis, and the budget is clearly stated and broken down. Having said that, their main focus appears to be territorial/land registry, with no verifiable experience in the crypto sector, nor in the Cardano community prior to Fund7; I would strongly recommend incorporating this information in a future iteration of the project. Although the end document proposed is surely feasible for the team, there are no clear KPIs that account for lobbying or networking; I would suggest as potential metrics the number of interviews to be conducted, specification of government bodies to be approached (like those that will comprise the Evaluating Committee, such as the Presidency of the Republic, the SFC, the Superintendencia de Sociedades and the Unidad de Información y Análisis Financiero, amongst others), etc.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided shows that there will be a concise product at the end of the stipulated 3-month period, which will show the success of the proposal. However, as stated above, there are no clear KPIs to be able to measure or audit the progress of the analysis and report. In this case, I would recommend that the analysis be broken down into deliverables that can be used as a monthly indication of the progress made, be it as independent chapters (for instance regarding previous regulation or SFC stances towards the cryptoeconomy, alliances partaking in the regulatory sandbox and their members´ track record vis-a-vis crypto, etc) or as stated above, as number of interviews held, with their recordings/conclusions being a possible deliverable for auditing purposes.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposing team has filed 2 proposals that are complementary. By performing analytic research on what the Colombian government is intending to impose as legislation, the informational chart from the other proposal can be updated to conformity. By doing this, the chances of successfully influencing legislative decisions rises significanlty. Such an analytical documenbt could hold great value for future ventures in the cryptographic sphere on Colombian territory.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal authors have relevant experience in the fields of law and government in Colombia and have provided evidence of this experience. By intending on making their research open-source, they are in a position of potentially helping a lot of projects. This increases feasibility significantly as cooperations will be desirable.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a complete set of auditables. There is a clear roadmap with funding breakdown, definition of succes after 3/6/12 months, risk analysis and concrete prospected release date in place along with measurable KPIs. Very good work.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a proposal on researching and piloting the application of electronic money in real life to see how it is received by citizens in Colombia. The proponent has legal experience in Colombia. The project is needed at the present time, raising public awareness about blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies in the countries.
f6_assessments.q1: Researching the community response as well as building a legal framework, a technology foundation for bringing cryptocurrency to life is absolutely necessary, and completely feasible at this stage of blockchain's development.
f6_assessments.q2: After the process is completed, the results of the research will be made public, and recommendations for next steps to raise awareness and practical application of cryptocurrencies will be made. This is a necessary stepping stone, supporting the serious implementation of cryptocurrencies into life.

f6_assessments.q0: Great idea. However, the proposal does not give a clear indication of the campaign that would enable favorable regulation. I would be glad if the team create a framework to serve as a reference point for favorable legislation in Columbia.
f6_assessments.q1: This team has experience lawyers and individuals in the public sector to achieve their goals. After reading the proposal, I am not getting a detailed plan and focus outcome for the project. I think the team should make their strategy clearer. What kind of specific benefit is the proposal aiming to measure.
f6_assessments.q2: There should be detailed activities for which the budget would be used. Also, the proposal should show how activities would be documented. This would be helpful for tracking and auditing.

solution: We will study the pilot in progress and obtain the necessary information to determine possible consequences.
experience: Fifteen years of experience in the Colombian public sector in entities such as the National Planning Department.
